ci_support_linux_64_c_stdlib_version2.17:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
is_freethreading:
- false
is_python_min:
- true
libblas:
- 3.9.* *netlib
libcint:
- '6.1'
microarch_level:
- 1
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
python_min:
- '3.10'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
- - python
  - is_python_min

about.summary: PySCF: Python-based Simulations of Chemistry Framework
PySCF: Python-based Simulations of Chemistry Framework
PySCF: Python-based Simulations of Chemistry Framework
PySCF: Python-based Simulations of Chemistry Framework

name: pyscf

about.summary: PySCF: Python-based Simulations of Chemistry Framework
PySCF: Python-based Simulations of Chemistry Framework

raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  version: "2.11.0"
  touch_is_freethreading: ${{ is_freethreading }}
  build_num: 1
  mlevel: ${{ (microarch_level | int) if microarch_level else 0 }}
  use_fast_math: ${{ linux and x86_64 and match(c_stdlib_version, ">=2.28") }}

package:
  name: "pyscf"
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/pyscf/pyscf/archive/refs/tags/v${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 314bb28890c36a151d4cae87b4077f0900f7d306880104b0fbbcbd0a8ae5b9ed

build:
  number: ${{ ( (build_num | int) + 100 * (mlevel | int) + (1000 if use_fast_math else 0) ) }}
  python:
    version_independent: true
  skip:
    - win
    - not is_python_min
    - microarch_level > 1 and not (unix and x86_64)
  script:
    - if: use_fast_math
      then:
        # this contains "-ffast-math"
        # libmvec's vector math was introduced in glibc 2.22,
        - cp $SRC_DIR/pyscf/lib/cmake_user_inc_examples/cmake.user.inc-gnu $SRC_DIR/pyscf/lib/cmake.arch.inc
        # need to link libm for -ffast-math
        - echo "link_libraries(m)" >> $SRC_DIR/pyscf/lib/cmake.arch.inc
    - if: (microarch_level == 4)
      then:
        # manually add the appropriate flags so we can cross compile for v4
        - export CFLAGS="${CFLAGS} -march=x86-64-v4"
        - export CXXFLAGS="${CXXFLAGS} -march=x86-64-v4"
        - export CPPFLAGS="${CPPFLAGS} -march=x86-64-v4"
    - export CMAKE_CONFIGURE_ARGS="${CMAKE_ARGS} -DBLAS_LIBRARIES=lapack;blas -DCMAKE_INSTALL_LIBDIR=lib -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON -DBUILD_LIBCINT=OFF -DBUILD_LIBXC=OFF -DBUILD_XCFUN=OFF -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=ON -LAH"
    - export CMAKE_BUILD_PARALLEL_LEVEL=${CPU_COUNT}
    - ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - cmake >=3.10
    - make
    - python
    - pip
    - sed
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
    - setuptools
    # following the trick in graph-tool-feedstock
    # to cross-compile for v4
    - if: unix and x86_64 and ( microarch_level < 4)
      then: x86_64-microarch-level ==${{ microarch_level }}
  host:
    - libblas
    - libcint
    - libxc-c >=6,<8
    - if: linux
      then: libgomp
      else: llvm-openmp
    - make
    - pip
    - python
    - setuptools
    - xcfun ==2.1.1
  run:
    - h5py >=2.7
    - numpy >=1.13,!=1.16,!=1.17
    - python
    - scipy >=0.19,!=1.5.0,!=1.5
    - setuptools
    - if: unix and x86_64 and (microarch_level == 4)
      then: _x86_64-microarch-level >=${{ microarch_level }}
  run_constraints:
    - pyberny >=0.6.2
    - geometric >=0.9.7.2

tests:
  - if: (microarch_level != 4)
    then:
      - python:
          imports:
            - pyscf
            - pyscf.dft
            # Tests LIBXC and XCFUN
          python_version: ["${{ python_min ~ '.*' }}", "3.11.*", "3.12.*", "3.13.*"]
          pip_check: true
  - if: (microarch_level != 4)
    then:
      - script:
        - cp pyscf_conf.py .pyscf_conf.py
        - pytest pyscf/lib pyscf/scf -s -c pytest.ini --no-cov # Previously this ran: # pytest pyscf/lib pyscf/scf -s -c setup.cfg --cov-report xml --cov-report term --cov-config .coveragerc --cov pyscf # Disabled due to python 3.12.1 memory leak. Should be resolved in python 3.12.2
        requirements:
          run:
            - pip
            - pytest
            - pytest-cov
        files:
          source:
            - .coveragerc
            - pytest.ini
            - pyscf
          recipe:
            - pyscf_conf.py

about:
  homepage: https://pyscf.org
  summary: 'PySCF: Python-based Simulations of Chemistry Framework'
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_file: LICENSE
  repository: https://github.com/pyscf/pyscf

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - awvwgk
    - maxscheurer
    - BastianZim
